job description:
Data Governance Analyst Sr.

09-17-2018

What You'll Do
The Data Governance Analyst Sr. will be responsible for serving as a subject matter expert on data governance and records management. This person will report to the Director of Information Security Risk Management, who describes this role as "making sure we have the right information in the right hands, at the right time. This role will bring that single point of focus to a number of different functions at UMB."
Key highlights of this role will include the following:
  • Showing ownership of job responsibilities, and indirectly managing business partner priorities
  • Supporting the execution of a multi-year roadmap to enhance UMB's data governance and records management capabilities
  • Maintaining great working relationships with key stakeholders (e.g. Record Coordinators, Data Stewards, etc.) to meet program objectives.
  • Conducting periodic risk and gap assessments to evaluate existing controls
  • Providing regular reporting on program objectives to senior leadership
  • Promoting program objectives throughout the organization, providing input to UMB's Security Awareness Program
  • Providing input on information security policies, along with standards and procedures owned by business partners
  • Evaluating new regulatory developments or industry guidance, providing recommendations to mitigate potential gaps
  • Leading special projects as assigned

In this Role, You will Need
  • In-depth knowledge of data governance and records management best practices.
  • Experience in conducting, assessing or governing data classification, records management or data disposal processes, along with risk assessments or compliance testing.
  • Strong knowledge of risk and controls.
  • Ability to think and plan strategically.
  • Strong organizational and planning skills.
  • Strong risk analysis skills.
Who You Are
  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline from an accredited college or university. Or equivalent work experience.
  • Five (5) years of experience in audit, risk management, or compliance, with a focus on data governance or records management.
